evidence.text:
Person B: Will he be all right-?
Person B: Let him sleep tomorrow. I can be here early to- hold a place.

Person B: Yes, that's right. That looks right, doesn't it? The books shall fan outwards, you see?
Person B: Like so.

Person A: Slowly, boys!
Person A: All right, good! Now left. To the left!
Person A: I said to be careful, goddammit!
Person B: Get a hold of that thing! The group is frozen, spooked. ATTILA calls out...

Person B: A rose must remain with the sun and the rain Or its lovely promise won't come true To Each His Own, To Each His Own And my own is you-
Person B: To Each His Own by Eddy Howard overtakes the soundtrack.
Person B: Give me a few inches.
Person B: There's a son of a bitch here to see you.

Person A: They can wait...
Person B: Jesus, Gordon.
Person A: We can take you down there in the morning if you are curious.
Person B: What do you say we get you in one of them machines?
Person B: You have a kid. I'll give you something and you'll take it.

Person B: Stay out of it, Gordon.
Person B: Stay out of it, I said, or you can go with him!

Person A: What's wrong with you?
Person A: You shout at me again and you'll be sorry.
Person B: You too! Get out of here.
